title: Drawing, "Hades; Persephone in the Underworld (Offering to Proserpine)", ca. 1820
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and brown wash, graphite on paper
inscribed: Inscribed in black ink, lower left: L. 2; in graphite, left margin and lower right: 119
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Proserpina, Pluto and Sleep are shown at right seated upon a platform, with the Fates standing behind them. Proserpina extends a branch toward a girls lead to her by Death, a bearded man with a bat upon his head and his name “VS” upon his right sleeve. A man supporting a dead woman comes from left; a boy clings to him. Others come to perform sacrifices. The setting is the hall of the Underworld, lighted by lamps. Other parts of the Underworld with a wheel of torture are shown in the background.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Hades; Persephone in the Underworld (Offering to Proserpine)", ca. 1820.Pen and black ink, brush and brown wash, graphite on paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-3345.
